newsitem.title: SWEDEN: SAS Cargo says lifts freight capacity to Asia.
newsitem.headline: SAS Cargo says lifts freight capacity to Asia.

text.p: SAS Cargo said on Monday it was increasing its freight capacity from Scandinavia to Asia by 100 tonnes a week starting from August 17.
SAS Cargo said in a statement it would lay on another Boeing 747 freight plane to Asia each week.
Currently it has two flights go to Macao/Hong Kong each week and two to Osaka in Japan. The new flight will go to Macao.
"Macao is a very strategic location for a Scandinavian company to serve the fast growing market that is developing in Hong Kong, southern China and Taiwan," the statement said.
SAS Cargo said its freight service between Gothenburg and the Far East goes via Sharjah in the United Arab Emirates three times a week.
SAS Cargo's freight plane has a capacity of 100 tonnes and can be used to send large shipments directly from Scandinavia to Asia.
